Based on the feedback provided by your colleagues, here are some suggestions to improve the code:

1. Thoroughly test the code with different input scenarios to ensure it produces correct results. Consider implementing unit tests to automate the testing process and catch any potential bugs or issues.

2. Ensure that the code is well-structured and follows best coding practices. Consider breaking down the code into smaller, reusable functions to improve readability and maintainability.

3. Make sure the code meets the requirements and constraints specified in the problem statement. Provide clear documentation on how the code works and how to run it to facilitate future maintenance and updates.

4. Consider incorporating the suggestions provided by the Terminology Interpreter to enhance the understanding of linear programming concepts, decision variables, and constraints in the code.

By incorporating these suggestions, you can improve the overall quality of the code and ensure it meets the standards set by your colleagues.
